alert.note: Alert for North Snowy Range Foothills; Snowy Range (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: High Wind Warning issued April 04 at 3:07AM MDT until April 06 at 6:00AM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 6 AM MDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...West to southwest winds 50 to 60 MPH with frequent gusts to 85 MPH expected. Occasional gusts 90 to 100 MPH are possible. * WHERE...Snowy Range and adjacent foothills including Centennial, Arlington, and Elk Mountain. * WHEN...Noon MDT Monday until 6 AM MDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Mainly to transportation. Strong cross winds will be hazardous to light weight and high profile vehicles, including campers and tractor trailers. There will be an extreme risk for vehicle blow overs! Tree damage is also possible near the Snowy Range. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A period of falling snow is also expected between 9PM Monday and 12PM Tuesday, with blowing snow continuing after. Accumulations of 4 to 8 inches are expected in the highest elevations of the Snowy Range and 1 to 3 inches is possible in adjacent foothills. Near blizzard conditions will be possible at times.
info.instruction: A High Wind Warning means a hazardous high wind event is expected or occurring. Sustained wind speeds of at least 40 mph or gusts of 58 mph or more can lead to property damage.

area.areaDesc: North Snowy Range Foothills; Snowy Range
